Posts.Content: good morning Ladies I have taking Tamoxifen since July and have the most awful symptoms. I understand with insomnia I keep waking up all night long but the biggest one I have are the extreme hot flushes. I am in the menopause anyway due to a hysterectomy a few years ago and the flushes were not too back but now they have intensified soooo much I don't need a coat in this hot weather it is driving me insane. Also at times I feel helpless and get angry at the slightest thing. I wish we could all get a miracle tablet but as per Jewel it is a hard decision to make whether to take these tablets or not. Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Choosing whether to continue into another five years of hormone t...

Posts.Content: Thanks Leolady for the advice which is very helpful. I will need to speak to my HR department as we do not have an OH person so I will have a definite line of attack if this happens. I think that person is being unkind as she is that kind of person in passing. Again thanks and you take care to Wendy XXXX
Posts.Title: What can I do???

Posts.Content: Hi Libby That does not sound fair at all for you. I cant have a fan in the main office as they complained last time and the office is cold in winter but I don't notice at all and they wont put on more layers either even though I did suggest it last winter. I am happier where I am and am mote productive in my work as well but they does not like to see anyone happy. I hope things work out for you. xx
Posts.Title: What can I do???

Posts.Content: Good morning to everyone I was wondering if anyone has any advice on the following: I was moved out of our main office back in January due to taking Tamoxifin at the time and having the horrible intense hot flushes and I screamed at someone to either turn off or turn down the heating as it was affecting me quite a bit and they know my situation. I am now on Letrozole. I was moved into an office on my own for which I am  very happy in as I can have the window open when I want and the heating if it gets a bit chilly. But our head office is closing and they are putting people in other offices where there is space to be used and someone has whispered in my ear that I could be going back into there so she can come in here. I am not sure if it is true or not but I do not want to go back in the other room as my colleagues do not either understand or do not want to and even a year later don't give a damn about other peoples feelings when I get no support from anyone but expect me to support them. Maybe people may think I am being selfish but  I am the only person looking after myself for some reason even my partner does not seem to give as monkey's at the moment. Sorry if I sound a bit down!! Wendy W xxxx
Posts.Title: What can I do???

Posts.Content: Good morning Ladies Just a little update on the problem I was having a few weeks ago. I am fighting not to g back into our main office. I have let our HR department know the situation and have asked them to put my email on hold at the moment as had a long talk with our CFO and manager and they will have to see what can be came up with the silly ides of me sitting near the office door which will not do anything for the flushes. I also got a letter from my GP and have sent a copy to our HR department to say that I cannot sit in a room of certain temperatures and hopefully this will help. Hugs to all Wendy xxx
Posts.Title: What can I do???

Posts.Content: Hi Kirky Many thanks for the link I have printed it off and am also emailing it to a friend who was diagnosed with this awful disease a couple of weeks ago as she is going to go through more than I did. Thanks for your help and information it will help[ if I have to go in fighting. Wendy W xx
Posts.Title: What can I do???

Posts.Content: Hi I have been on Tamoxifen for just over 2 months and as I am already menopausal due to hysterectomy just over 2 years ago it has made my hot flushes making me feel like I am sitting in front of a radiator so that has just intensified. I take mine in the mornings along with tablets for other health conditions. Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Swelling and pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Good morning Leolady Does the Sea Kelp really help as I have been on Letrozole since January and have fine hair anyway but have noticed it is getting thinner so I keep it in a short bob. Was taking the awful Tamoxifin before but fine this not much better so stiff and achy all the time. Will look into the sea kelp just another tablet to take. Have a wonderful day!!! Wendy W xx
Posts.Title: Letrozole - hair thinning

Posts.Content: Leolady56 Thanks for the advice and I will look into and hopefully get some of this to grow. Wendy W
Posts.Title: Letrozole - hair thinning

Posts.Content: Hi Daydream Many thanks. I hope it does to I know it will happen soon.Wow must not be fun feeling cold like that all time. You need some on the heat I have :) You take care xx
Posts.Title: Swelling and pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hey there Daydream I already had hot flushes due to already being menopausal. But they have got worse since taking Tamoxifen. Maybe that is your bodies version of a hot flush lucky you but maybe you need to talk to someone regarding your implant. I am still waiting for radiotherapy to start but cant until the blood clot I have stops leaking. x
Posts.Title: Swelling and pain after mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks Cords it was a good day.  Winky xxx
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Hi Boobylou thanks and may thanks for the advice just not looking forward to all of the water I wee so much as it is :)
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Morning Val Many thanks for the reassurance it is greatly appreciated. It just feels like I am going into the unknown but I know that it has an ending eventually. Thanks again Wendy
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Hi AnneCC That is so good congratulations more money to help more people out. Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Hi Jbelle Thanks and I was so happy to do it as I hope it helps others in the future. As to my Rads I am feeling worried but as I know one day there will be a light at the end of my tunnel. Wendy xxxxx
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Good afternoon to all I hope everyone is keeping well and getting plenty of rest. We held a Macmillan coffee day at my work on Friday and a lot of kind people came from our other offices as we are an estate agents and kindly ate cake, drank teas and contributed more cake and their money. We managed to make just under £340.00 and work is contributing a match of £250.00 so this had made my week. By the end of the day I was very tired but happy. I only managed 2pieces of cake all day so felt a bit ill. I thanked my work colleagues for their help in contributing and their help in this venture. I finally start my radiotherapy on Monday 9th of Ocotober finally. Big hugs and kisses to all you ladies out there as this site has helped me in my darkest times over the past few weeks. I feel so lucky that it was caught early but I no my journey is not finished yet . Xxxxxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Hi Jess I have a couple of pics but I do not know how to upload them. It is the table full of cakes and a poster we made with the prices but it is very cheeky Wendy
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: This is the sign we put up before anyone could enter the room lol Xx Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Bedford69 that is fantastic I held mine at work and they have been so supportive I still have Rads to go. It does feel good ti give back to those that have helped us. xx
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Jess It was such a pleasure to do and at the end of the day it goes towards helping others with services that Macmillan supply and help everyone. Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Hi The only photos i  of our coffee day is one of the table before everyone munched on the cakes and one of the sign we made with the prices and also the terms and conditions. xx Wendy xxth
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies as per last we held a cake day in our work and raised just under £340.00 but I have just found out that our head office is going to double it instead of just the extra £250.00 they usually give I am so surprised and please for Macmillan. Hugs to all Wendy xxx
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Thanks Belle i am trying not to think about it too much. it will be fine and my work were great regarding doubling the money. you have a great weekend to  Wendy xxx
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Good morning Belle Many thanks for the support it is greatly appreciated and being on this site with all you lovely ladies has been such a help. I think I will worry all of this week until the Rads start as that is how I am. It is hard to explain to my partner how I feel he just says you will be ok and I know that light at the end of the tunnel will be there for all of us ones of these days. Hope you have a good week to and send you lots of hugs as well. xxxx
Posts.Title: Macmillan coffee day

Posts.Content: Good morning to all Went for a hospital appointment with my surgeon yesterday. got told I may not start my Radiotherapy next month as at the moment part of my incision has a blood clot trying to get out so at the moment am leaking blood. He sent me for a scan and the doctor there told me that it was still too thick to aspirate so have to still wear dressings and am going on holiday to Spain as week from Saturday. Sorry if I am moaning just getting very frustrated as I know that there are people worse off than me as it will be 6 weeks tomorrow since I had a Segmental Mastectomy. I am seeing my oncologist for the 2nd time this Friday so hopefully something good will come out of it. I am supposed to go for my planning next Tuesday morning do not know what to do :( Winky 49
Posts.Title: May not have Radiotherapy (Getting very frustrated)

Posts.Content: Hi Maxine Many thanks for your response and helps me in the waiting. Hope all goes well with you. regards, Winky
Posts.Title: May not have Radiotherapy (Getting very frustrated)

Posts.Content: Hi Lennie Thanks for the information it is of great help to me. Best wishes to you
Posts.Title: May not have Radiotherapy (Getting very frustrated)

Posts.Content: Hi Raggarty I am sorry to hear that you have still not started like me. It is very frustrating with the leaking I have been in a bit of a funk for the last couple of days and it is also my mums birthday today and she passed away back at the end of April it has been a really crap year. Just take deep breathes when you start to panic and it may help with your heart to. I will most certainly speak to my oncologist this Friday and hopefully sort something out. My partner and  I will be staying outside of Torremolinos cannot wait for some real sunshine as so grey here in London. You take care of yourself. Best Wishes winky
Posts.Title: May not have Radiotherapy (Getting very frustrated)

Posts.Content: Hi Kerry Sorry to hear you are unhappy. but it is good to have a good rant and this is most definitely the best place to do it. I even feel angry at times as my family are 12,000 miles away in Australia but have not heard from one of them since my diagnosis and operation except one sister but that was quite a few weeks ago. I just rant and rave at home when my partner is not there but I hope you feel better soon and take care. xx
Posts.Title: Big old rant!

Posts.Content: Good morning Went for my 3rd go at planning for my RT this morning and 3rd time lucky I am able to start on the 9th of October. Cannot wait only having 19 sessions. Have to keep an eye on my main incision due to it has finally stopped leaking my blood clot but there said there could be a small Serenoma and I am type 2 diabetic so take ages to heal. hugs to all xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: My Treatment Plan

Posts.Content: Ohh thanks ladies for the advice and luck. I will follow it to the letter. I hope it does go quickly and good thing I drink lots of water already. I will come on here if there are any problems of just for a chat and a hug. Hugs to all xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: My Treatment Plan

Posts.Content: Hi Mazza I am so sorry that you are being ignored by your son but we are all for you here on this website. It sounds like what my siblings are like and they live 12000 miles away from me in Australia. The worst is my oldest sister who did not even with me Merry Christmas so for now I am forgetting about them and thinking of myself and my partner. I would never dream of treating them badly even though I live here in the UK I would still be phoning them at least weekly to see how they are but since our mum passed last year no one can be bothered to see how I am. I hope all goes well for you and take care of yourself as you are the important one in this situation. You will get lots of supports and hugs for all of us ladies xxxx  Wendy
Posts.Title: Bit Scared and a Lot Angry

Posts.Content: Morning Sal Many thanks for the lovely reply and I really appreciate it. I have read your replies to other people and they sure make me laugh. I can understand why you need the me time as you are going through so much yourself and hope you are taking care of yourself. I hope you have a lovely weekend to Wendy xxxx
Posts.Title: Was Feeling down

Posts.Content: Hi Optimistic Many thanks for your wise words they do help very much. I hope you are doing much better yourself now. I have some time to myself on Monday as am taking a day off work for me time. Hope you have a peaceful weekend to xx
Posts.Title: Was Feeling down

Posts.Content: Good morning Ladies I had a very bad day yesterday as could not shake off feeling really down. It just came over me all of a sudden and I went into my face book account and wrote about people not asking how I am as I have not heard from my siblings at all back in my home country even though I have lived in the UK for over 28 years. The only people to respond was my oldest nephew and his wife. They were very honest in saying that they were too scared to ask but I just told them that it is ok to be scared but just ask me what you want to know. I said that they got it all I have had Radiotherapy and hopefully that has killed any stray cells if there were any to begin with. They told me they loved me and I told them I loved them back and will keep them updated but for the moment I have logged out of this account for a while until I can get some peace in my mind. My partner even asked me last night why I was not talking much to him which makes a change as sometimes he thinks I talk too much as he had read what I put on face book. I just told him that I just did not want to talk much and just need a bit of peace good thing he understood. Today I feel a bit better but maybe tonight I might just go home for a good cry as they are just sitting there waiting to come out. Sorry ladies for rambling on but hope this gets me through the rest of my working day as now it is the weekend and I am off work on Monday so will get a bit of peace then. Hugs to all xxx
Posts.Title: Was Feeling down

Posts.Content: Mornin Mrsox Thanks so much for your lovely reply and everyone on here is so great even though some are going through more than others we are all following the same type of path. You are so funny and have made me smile. I will try and keep smiling xxx
Posts.Title: Was Feeling down

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies hope you are all well. Could I please join the Walking back to Happiness. I sit at my desk all day but can try and manage the walk back to my tube station after my day is done. It is cold out there though. Wendy W
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Good afternoon Moomy Hope you are keeping well. I really do not like Letrozole. I keep moving and I have been in so much pain lately with the aching my GP has had to refer me back to my Oncologist. I understand with the horrible hot flushes I wont need a heater come winter time Takes care lovely ladies Hugs xxxxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Thanks Lynn for your advice to it has all been very much appreciated form all of you ladies. They are all younger than me by quite a few years I am 50 this year. I used to be friendly with one of them but she stabbed me in the  back by saying she has had to make compromises for me but now I feel it is me who has to make the compromises and they keep telling me that we are a team which is a lot of rubbish. I will try very hard to keel my temper and move on . Wendy xx
Posts.Title: need some advice regarding my job

Posts.Content: Hi Unico4rn Many thanks for you advice above I have taken it all in after reading it a few times. I work in an office of 5 people used to be ten for a large estate agents. I don't want to move but seem to have no choice even though they said it was my choice I have been to feel it isn't. I am going to make them come to me I have gone out and bought a small radio from petty cash so I am not sitting in silence. I have not spoken to one particular person for a few weeks and I am usually a chatty person but now cannot be bothered anymore and just sit here with my earphones in. I know I will be fine and may look for a new job after I see my Oncologist next week but am scared I will not get another one if new employers know that I have had breast cancer. Wendy xx
Posts.Title: need some advice regarding my job

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I just need a little advice please. I take Tamoxifen which you all know make you extremely hot. I am being moved out of the office I work in into one on my own as at times I do need the window open. People have moaned about me and that they are cold even though the heating is on very high so will have to work on my own and will not know what is going on with the rest of the department I work for. do not know whether to stay angry or cry cannot tell my partner as he will be fuming. Wendy W
Posts.Title: need some advice regarding my job

Posts.Content: I cant work from home as I work in a finance department doing accounts payable so I have requested that everything I use be moved with me so people will have to come to me and not me to them. I will look up the equality act thanks for the advice it does help. xx
Posts.Title: need some advice regarding my job

Posts.Content: Thanks Wicked43 for the advice as well and thanks to the other ladies as well and will go to my HR department for a little chat and see where I stand with this company. Wendy
Posts.Title: need some advice regarding my job

Posts.Content: thanks Leolady for your knowledge everyone has been so helpful I will keep you posted. Wendy Xx
Posts.Title: need some advice regarding my job

Posts.Content: Thanks Leolady maybe I should get some boxing gloves. You take care to Wendy
Posts.Title: need some advice regarding my job

Posts.Content: Hi BC I have a small fan I bought myself and they moaned about that so am in a no win situation. Wendy
Posts.Title: need some advice regarding my job

Posts.Content: Hi Ellyse I am Wendy and I will be 50 in a few months time. I don't think people in any job know how to ask the right questions to a person who has or has had cancer. And having to describe to people what you have had done. mine was  a lumpectomy/Sentinel nodes now on Letrozole after having that horrible Tamoxifen for over 6 months. now have more symptoms to look forward to. I had to describe why I had  my hysterectomy to a male manager in 2015 I was very embarrassed but he was embarrassed more so served him right for asking :) Like you I have had quite a few ops over the past few years and have the battle scars to prove it. I think just take you time once you get back to work or maybe see if you can start back gradually. I am sorry to read that you have had a rough time and hope you also get your op very soon for your boob. Have a lovely day Wendy W xxx Gentle hugs for you
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: Good morning Ladies I think we been and are still there. I worked through all mine it was only a small tumour and Radiotherapy afterwards but the shock of it sure throws you off of your axis. I understand that if one more person says to me also you look like you have not had cancer I will kick their backsides as they do not understand what it can do to a person and what the treatments and also the worry of if it is going to come back. I am Letrozole now was on Tamoxifen but that was awful but still am having awful flushes. We will all get there and coming on here even though I don't say much just reading what the ladies write is sometime the thing to help me get though the day. SO THANKS TO ALL THE LADIES ON THIS SITE FOR ALL OF YOUR HELP AND HUGS TO ALL AND LOVE !!!! Wendy W
Posts.Title: Once treatment has finished..getting back “to normal “

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I have been on Letrozole since January. My joints are in such pain and lots of stiffness since I have started taking it. I sit down in my job so when I go to stand up I end up limping due to pain and the stiffness. My GP sent me for xrays on my hips and I have arthritis but I also have Sciatica. I am waiting for an appointment with a physio so hopefully they will be able to help. Mine is my Left hip got given cocodomol only take it when trying to sleep but not getting much of that at the moment. Hope it all improves for all of us Wendy W xxx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole hip pain, diagnosed with bursitis

Posts.Content: Thanks Karen and I hope everything gets sorted for you but at least this tablet keeps us alive Take care Wendy W xx
Posts.Title: Anastrozole hip pain, diagnosed with bursitis

Posts.Content: Hi Gail Just your reply helps I know I am not alone. I hope you are well.  I hope some of the ladies can help as well. Take care Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Aching bones with Letrozol

Posts.Content: Hi Moomy Any information helps people in different ways. It is nice to have as much info as possible if it at least can help one person or several people. Many thanks and big hugs Wendy W xx
Posts.Title: Aching bones with Letrozol

Posts.Content: Hi Gail You have helped me before. I hope it does go as all I want to do is go to asleep here at work. I have worked all the way through but at the time of my Rads I was also studying and ended up and also failed my exam. I am meant to getting back into my studying but just don't seem to have any energy at the moment. xxx
Posts.Title: Tiredness nearly three months after finishing Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hey there G n'J Many thanks for the useful information. I did not get told much but will have to wait until after Easter now as it was my Oncologist who sent me and my GP has no results as I phoned them this morning. Have a good Easter Wendy
Posts.Title: DEXA Scan

Posts.Content: Hi Boobylou I wish I could have a rest in the day but I work and have done all the way through. Some days I could just curl up in a corner. I try to walk from my work to the tube stations only takes 10 minutes but at the moment it feels like I am walking up hill so I take the bus. I need to get back into walking as I used to love it. Even going to do the shopping at the weekend knackers me out I have to go by bus as we don't have a car. xxx
Posts.Title: Tiredness nearly three months after finishing Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Jan Many thanks for your reply it has been very helpful as have all of the others. I am home today as am feeling not very well was sitting at my desk at work feeling sick so thought it was best not to stay all day. Hugs and love back to you and all of the other ladies on here today Xxxx
Posts.Title: Tiredness nearly three months after finishing Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Gail Many thanks for your lovely response it is greatly appreciated. This forum has helped me in many ways over the past seven months and has also helped my sanity. Wendy xxx
Posts.Title: Tiredness nearly three months after finishing Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Thanks Helen for the helpful information. I am still all new to this and they don't tell you at the doctors. Wendy x
Posts.Title: leaky breast

Posts.Content: Hi Gina sorry you have to go through this with all us but at least you have an understanding already. I hope your treatment goes well for you. I hope this thread keeps going as there are a lot of ladies out there who have had a lot of advice to give. I was on Tamoxifen before Letrozole and it was awful as well but I am menopausal so got changed to this and things have not improved. I am trying to take it day by day. You take care of yourself to Wendy W xx
Posts.Title: Aching bones with Letrozol

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady Many thanks for the advice I think these are thinks I do need to Look into as have had anaemia in the past.  I am trying to be gentle with myself  You take care to Wendy W
Posts.Title: Tiredness nearly three months after finishing Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Thanks for the hug and the advice. I already have type 2 diabetes,for the past 20years. I need to start walking from the tube station to work Andrew back again in the evenings. I will ask about the thyroid though as that does run in my family. Again thanks for the lovely hug xxxx
Posts.Title: Tiredness nearly three months after finishing Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: I think I will need a prescription as they are quite stingy at my local hospital. Luckily I don't pay for prescription as I have type diabetes as well as high blood pressure. I just try and keep it clean but I have heard of Manuka honey. At least you are not a horse :) I will be very persistant tomorrow and ask for loads.
Posts.Title: leaky breast

Posts.Content: Hi Gail Again you have given me good Advice. I will call my Oncologist after Easter as I had the scan in February. Even though my tumour is gone I know we all still worry if it is going to come back. I have back pain at the moment and the all the GP gave was some exercises to do which I am doing religiously and taking pain killer. I guess I will put my mind at rest once I have the results. Huge hugs back to you and to everyone else on here. xxxxxxxxxxx Hope you all have a lovely restful Easter   Wendy W xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: DEXA Scan

Posts.Content: Hi Gay Many thanks for the information. I have tried different brands over the past few months and I still have bad flushes and am very achy. Sometimes I just don't want to get out of bed and my fingers do get stiff and my job involves data entry of all things. My worst is my back as I cannot put pressure on my right side shoulder blade as sometimes it feels like it is burning. I will look into the supplement just have to be careful what I take as I also take other medication for high blood pressure and type 2 diabetes so a total of 12 tablets a day including the Letrozole. I am going to see how I go but may have a chat with my GP first if I can get an appointment. Have a lovely day Wendy W
Posts.Title: Aching bones with Letrozol

Posts.Content: Hi Mira I think it is different in whatever country you live in. I am in London and it is whatever my chemist gets I have asked for a different kind and they have all effected me in different ways. I still get the hot flushes as well like when I was on Tamoxifen but the achy bones are too much at the moment but I have upped my water as well and am trying to walk more as when I get up out of bed or a chair I am very stiff worse If I have been sitting on a bus or the under ground for a long time. hope all goes well for you Hugs to you to  Wendy W
Posts.Title: Aching bones with Letrozol

Posts.Content: Hi Cloud8 I wish you all the best and hope things work for you as this medication is awful. I take other medication as well for diabetes and high blood pressure and also wonder is them all missing together does not do me any good. We will see. Again wish you all the best Wendy W
Posts.Title: Aching bones with Letrozol

Posts.Content: Good morning to all As per the title I have a leaky breast. I had a lumpectomy and nodes taken back in July and since then have had a leaky blood clot coming out of the main incision. Just changing dressing at least twice a day but costing me the earth and in the mornings it is coming out a little green. Have got an appointment tomorrow afternoon with my surgeon am so frustrated. Wendy XXX
Posts.Title: leaky breast

Posts.Content: Good afternoon ladies I don't come on here very often at the moment. I have been on Letrozole since late January this year and since taking it I have been getting very tired and achy all over like having the flue even though I don't have it and also a lot of tiredness. I have also have a lot of pain in my right shoulder blade. I have tried different brands but no luck. does anyone have any advice please? Wendy W
Posts.Title: Aching bones with Letrozol

Posts.Content: Hi Susy I don't hate you,  you are very lucky not to have any symptoms we are just unlucky this happens and it is our bodies that let us down no matter how hard we try. Regards, Wendy W
Posts.Title: Aching bones with Letrozol

Posts.Content: Hi Elaine I think some of it is different for everyone and thing work for some and not for others. there are a lot of ladies who have either had not a lot of problems or nothing at all. Lets see how we all get on and hopefully we all even out at some stage. Hug and love to all Wendy W xxx
Posts.Title: Aching bones with Letrozol

Posts.Content: Good afternoon ladies hope you are having a good chat on here this afternoon. I was just wondering if anyone has still had any tiredness months after finishing Radiotherapy? Any help would be great. Hugs to all Wendy W
Posts.Title: Tiredness nearly three months after finishing Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi misty Yes I am in the uk. I have just come back from a holiday in spain. I know regarding the dressing but everytime I ask they give me just a few but will kick up a fuss tomorrow. I hope it isn't an infection as it will hold up my Radiotherapy which I really want to start but am going to see them on Wednesday morning. I last saw the hospital a few weeks ago and I just want this situation sorted now.
Posts.Title: leaky breast

Posts.Content: I sure will take care Wendy
Posts.Title: leaky breast

Posts.Content: Hi Raggarty Yes I remember you. I have not put anything on it but clean dressings each day after having a shower and just running clear water over it. I am seeing my surgeon this afternoon and am going to ask him to assess it and also for some more dressing as I was in Spain on holiday last week and thought I had packed enough but didn't and had to buy some wow expensive but they were very good in the Pharmacy. I hope yours is sorted soon it would be good if both of us could get on with the Radiotherapy and finally finish. Best Wishes to you and take care and many thanks for the information regarding the ProntoSan.
Posts.Title: leaky breast

Posts.Content: Hi Honey and lemon I am going to ring my Oncologist after Easter to see if they have the results as I had the scan in early February. I hope you are doing ok. Wendy W xx
Posts.Title: DEXA Scan

Posts.Content: Good afternoon Ladies Hope everyone is feeling ok and coping with this damn rain. I was wondering if anyone has had a DEXA scan and how long it took for the results to come back? I had one last month as have been put on Letrozole but have still not had the results. I phoned my GP and they have not been sent any results so am not sure if to ring my Oncologist's secretary or not??? Wendy W
Posts.Title: DEXA Scan

Posts.Content: Hi Ladies I am sorry to read that the Awake forum has been locked. Not very fare because someone else is angry. I do not come on here very often but everyone on here has helped in one way or another since I was diagnosed almost a year ago nest week. We are here to help each other if we can and I have never had or seen any bullying whatsoever. So lets all just get along and hopefully all the ladies will be here to support you. As before I am sorry to read about your friend. Wendy W xxxx
Posts.Title: GREAT TIMING......

Posts.Content: Well we held our cake day yesterday and we have made just over £300 which I am so proud of.  I hope everyone can see these pics  I had a wonderful time and my colleagues made contributions and ate lots of cake and drank tea and coffee.  Hug to all Wendy Wood xxxxx
Posts.Title: Macmillan Cake Day

Posts.Content: Hi to all At the moment here at my work we are holding a Macmillan Cake day and people are in and out contributing money and eating lots of cake and as it is between 10 am and 4pm hope to make more for Macmillans. Will try and add photos next week of all the cake. Wendy xx Hugs to all xxxx
Posts.Title: Macmillan Cake Day

Posts.Content: Hi Deb Many thanks for the help I will try and get to my gp before my holiday. Hug and rainbows back at ya xxx
Posts.Title: itchy breast

Posts.Content: Hi Gay I can’t even bake so will provide store bought cakes instead and hope to raise some good cash fro Macmillan’s. WENDY XX
Posts.Title: Worlds Biggest Coffee Morning

Posts.Content: Good morning to all on this beautiful Sunny day Next Friday 29th of September is Macmillan's Biggest Coffee morning. I work in accounts for an estate agents and am doing this in our office and have invited other members of staff from other offices to come and have cake and beverages and also make a donation to a good cause so hopefully lots of people will come and contribute especially if cake is included. I am looking forward to this and also meeting some staff that I have spoken to on the phone and by email but never in person. Have a lovely day all Lot of hugs to everyone on this website xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Worlds Biggest Coffee Morning

Posts.Content: Well Gay and Londonlass I am going to do the best I can to get as much ones as I can and eat cake to  I hope a lot of my work colleagues come along for cake to  Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Worlds Biggest Coffee Morning

Posts.Content: Thanks TAllantire Thanks I am quite new on here. Was told back at the end of June op in July lumpectomy and nodes. They say they got it all just waiting to start Rads. I am happy to do this as per above for such a good cause at my work as not many people knew I had BC. Some have been a good support but most of all my partner has been so good as I have no family in the uk but do not hear from my siblings anyway as my mum passed away earlier this year. I hope everyone has a lovely sunny day as the sun is shining for a change here in London. Hugs to all xxx Wendy
Posts.Title: Worlds Biggest Coffee Morning

Posts.Content: Hi all My radiotherapy is on hold at the moment due to a blood clot that is coming out of my incision which has been leaking for almost three weeks now. Really getting on my nerves buy now my breast is very itchy but need to keep dressing on due to the leaking. Are antihistamines safe to take as am on tamoxifen. Feeling down again this week hope it goes up as am off to spain for a weeks holiday on Saturday needs some sunshine. WinkyW49
Posts.Title: itchy breast

Posts.Content: Thanks Debs you have made my day :) I will move all I can good thing it is a short flights XX
Posts.Title: itchy breast

Posts.Content: Well Ladies We all deserve a piece of cake or 2 so enjoy it on Friday I will and make some money at the same time selling to my colleagues. I told them there is no alcohol though :) Mrsox enjoy your cake or 3 and Cords you will still get into that swimming costume and enjoy your quick break we all deserve them. Take care call and have a lovely day xxxxxxx
Posts.Title: Worlds Biggest Coffee Morning

Posts.Content: Hi machka I am so sorry to hear about your sister that is so sad. And what you are going through yourself at the moment as well. I wish you lots of hugs and love as I understand what you are going through. I lost my mum last year just before I was diagnosed, you will be strong but let yourself cry as well even use it as a release and eventually over time you will be fine. Just take your time with things and let it sink a bit at a time. Take care Hun xxx Wendy W xxx
Posts.Title: No tears left

Posts.Content: Mirabo that was such a good read. We are all strong enough to run and also fight the mountain lion and the bear. But it is all true and how I have felt at time to has made my day here at work. Wendy W xx
Posts.Title: Something I’d like to share

Posts.Content: Hi Emma I hope all goes well for you but it is best to have the tests and the biopsy even if it is just for peace of mind. I am new here to but I went to my GP because of fatty tissue under my left arm, they sent me to my local hospital who sent me for my first ever mammogram and ultrasound where they found a tiny lump instead in my right breast they said the size of the end of a pen. They did a biopsy same day and I had to wait 2 week before I was told I had breast cancer as I never had any symptoms at all so was glad for the fatty tissue under my left arm. I have had a lumpectomy and 3 nodes taken out back in the middle of July but at the moment have a leaky boob due to a blood clot working it way out so once it has all come out hopefully I will move onto my Radiotherapy days. Sounds weird cannot wait as walking around leaky is not my idea of fun. Please think positive and I will cross my fingers for you. Winky XX
Posts.Title: New and nervous

Posts.Content: Hi Ann They are not silly questions at all. I am on day 12 of 19 sessions and have kept my shoes on so then I can get out of there as quickly as possible. It was hot in the room yesterday boiling usually cool which I love. Must depend on the hospital. Wendy xx
Posts.Title: Silly radiotherapy question -

Posts.Content: Hi Lou1234 Welcome to the chat room. Everyone here has helped me even though I don't chat much but I do read a lot and they are all lovely as well. I hope it all goes well for you. Wendy W.xxx
Posts.Title: Hello, I’m new to this and would love a friendly hello

Posts.Content: Good morning Ladies hope you are all enjoying the sunshine while it is here. I was put on Tamoxifin last year after finishing my Rads early nobember17. It did take me into some dark places, also very bad hot flushes all day every day as already in menopause through a hysterectomy and tears..  I was also arguing with people I work due to them having heaters under their desks and I could not have a window even slightly open.  I am now in an office on my own which is good because I can have the window open as they like their office very hot and windows closed. Talk to your GPS or Oncologists if it causing a lot of these problems. I was put on Letrozole in January by my Oncologist as I had a blood test to prove I was in full Menopause which I have had for over three years and they put me on this which unfortunately I still get bad flushes and also very achy stiff joints now at the grand old age of 50. I even get a lot of spasms in my legs but it is what us ladies must do and if it helps the cancer from coming back I will out up with anything at the moment. Take care all Wendy W Please keep smiling as it will make everyone wonder what you have been up to!!!
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen & Low Moods

Posts.Content: Good morning I had a Wide incisions op and Sentinel nodes taken back in July for a very small DCIS but as above I only barely remember seeing the surgeon after my op but I ended up in the ICU because the anastethic doctors messed up with the breathing tube and my throat swelled up as they did not read the notes from another hospital where I had a hysterectomy a few years earlier as I have a short airway. They did not try the recommended until the 4th try and by then it was swollen. I woke up in there with a tube down my throat and the surgeon saying  I was ok. The head of ICU wrote a letter that I must give if I ever have another op to say how it must be done in future or I could end up there again. I went home 2 days later with a swollen breast and a very sore throat my poor partner thought he was picking me up from day surgery but instead had to see me like that and no one could tell me when I could go home. I thought all info in the leaflets would happen to but never did the BCN nurses took a week to call me back. Wendy
Posts.Title: Post op disappointment

Posts.Content: Thanks Jbelle I will xxxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY FRIDAY

Posts.Content: Good morning to all I would like to wish everyone a very HAPPY FRIDAY  thanks goodness it is here. I hope everyone gets all the rest and sleep they need and have a wonderful and restful weekend. LondonLass sounds like you need it the most at the moment hope you get some yourself. Hugs to all as I don't know how to add pics. xxxxxx
Posts.Title: HAPPY FRIDAY

Posts.Content: Hi Shelian the Radiotherapy went ok. Just take one day at a time as feelings can change day by day. I am sure there are people still in your life that love and cherish you as you are and friends like that are the ones to keep. I cope without my family just miss my mum. Hug just for you Wendy xxx
Posts.Title: 2 years after diagnosis so down

Posts.Content: Thanks. Sounds like your are surrounded by good and lovely people hold tightly onto them and don't let them go. You take care now we are all here for you. Wendy xx
Posts.Title: 2 years after diagnosis so down

Posts.Content: Hi Shelian I am new myself only been on here not quite 2 months but it is a fantastic site and the ladies on here are very understanding and very helpful. I am so sorry to read how down you are but people can be very disrespectful. I am finding it myself as some people just do not seem to want to know or want to understand. I was diagnosed back at the end of June had an op in July and am starting Radiotherapy this morning for 19 sessions. Am on Tamoxifen as well. My family are no help either they are back in my home country Australia and are older than me but not one of them has ask me how I am and coping. I try to stay strong for myself and my partner. Maybe you need to go and see you GP and ask for some help there if you need to talk my Name is Wendy and I am on here most days. You take care of yourself now and here are lots of virtual hugs. Wendy xxx
Posts.Title: 2 years after diagnosis so down
